description: a(n) = 3^(2^n) (or: write in base 3, read in base 9).
comments: a(n) is the second-highest value k such that A173419(k) = n+2. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Oct 03 2012Let b(0) = 6; b(n+1) = smallest number such that b(n+1) + Product_{i=0..n} b(i) divides b(n+1)*Product_{i=0..n} b(i). Then b(n+1) = a(n) for n >= 0. - _Derek Orr_, Dec 13 2014Changing "+" to "-": Let b(0) = 6; b(n+1) = smallest number such that b(n+1) - Product_{i=0..n} b(i) divides b(n+1)*Product_{i=0..n} b(i). Then b(n+2) = a(n) for n >= 0. - _Derek Orr_, Jan 04 2015
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..11
formula: a(0)=3 and a(n+1) = a(n)^2. - _Benoit Jubin_, Jun 27 2009
prog: (MAGMA) [3^(2^n): n in [0..8]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 15 2011(PARI) a(n)=3^2^n \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Oct 03 2012
author: Stephan Y Solomon (ilans(AT)way.com)
